short_summary: Request for proposal for geospatial web harvester development and operations
description: The purpose of this RFP is to seek proposals from bidders in response to this requirement “Geospatial Web Harvester Development and Operations.” This work will advance filter methodologies to increase the relevance of geospatial web service catalogue content, broaden endpoint services, and develop a catalogue harvesting framework that can serve as a procedural guideline for future SDI implementations both in Canada and internationally.
full_summary:
# Geospatial Web Harvester Development and Operations
================ مسئله conscient

## Background
Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) is seeking proposals from qualified bidders to develop and operate a geospatial web harvester. The purpose of this work is to create an automated system for cataloging and filtering geospatial web services and APIs.

## Overview
NRCan is seeking proposals for the development and operation of a geospatial web harvester that can collect, validate, filter, and publish geospatial web services and APIs. This work is part of NRCan's effort to advance the public access to geospatial information.

## Scope
The scope of the project is divided into two streams:

### Stream #1
Input an operational (subscription-based) Commercial Off The Shelf (COTS) geospatial web services/API harvester solution and provide weekly catalogues to NRCan and partners. The contractors may work with Stream 2 contractors to implement refinement solutions.

### Stream #2
Refine existing methodologies and explore new solutions for automatically harvesting, cataloging, validating, filtering, and publishing geospatial web services/APIs. Methodologies will be shared with Stream 1 contractors to implement.

## Key Deliverables

*   A functional geospatial web harvester that can collect, validate, filter, and publish geospatial web services and APIs
*   Weekly catalogues of geospatial web services and APIs
*   Methodologies for refining existing geospatial web service harvesting and delivery
*   A procedural guideline for future SDI implementations

## Important Details

*   NRCan is seeking up to two (2) contractors in Stream #1 and up to three (3) contractors in Stream #2.
*   The work is expected to start after the selection of the contractor(s).
*   NRCan is committed to working with the contractor(s) to ensure the successful delivery of the project.

## Contact Information
Raymond Thai can be contacted by email at [raymond.thai@NRCan-RNCan.gc.ca](mailto:raymond.thai@NRCan-RNCan.gc.ca) or by phone at (343) 543-7427.
